New Records: Roston Chase scored 42 off 27 balls to take the West Indies team to victory
Key Match Events: Roston Chase's unbeaten 42 off 27 balls stole the spotlight from Andre Russell
West Indies stuttered and stumbled before eventually scrambling a five-wicket win with an over to spare
Sese Bau's belligerent 50 off 43 balls represented the only meaningful contribution from PNG
Pre-Game Insights: PNG's bowling was clever and disciplined, slumping West Indies to 97 for five with only four overs left
Post-Match Reflections: Roston Chase conceded 26 runs from four overs of off-spin and also held a brilliant catch at backward point to remove PNG captain Assad Vala
West Indies captain Rovman Powell said they need to be better in all three departments of the game (batting, bowling and fielding)
Miscellaneous Highlights: This was just PNG's second appearance in a world tournament, having lost all three matches in their debut appearance at the 2021 T20 World Cup
PNG captain Assad Vala said they were happy with the fight they showed in trying to defend that total
Others: Brief scores: PNG 136-8 in 20 overs (Sese Bau 50, Kiplin Doriga 24 not out, Assad Vala 21; Andre Rusell 2-19, Alzarri Joseph 2-34) v West Indies 137-5 off 19 overs (Roston Chase 42 not out, Brandon King 34; Assad Vala 2-28, Alei Nao 1-9)
